text: John Lyly (1553 or 1554 â€“ November 1606; also spelled Lilly, Lylie, Lylly) was an English writer, dramatist, courtier, and parliamentarian. he was best known during his lifetime for his two books Euphues: The Anatomy of Wit (1578) and its sequel Euphues and His England (1580). == References == * Hunter, G. K. (1962). John Lyly: The Humanist as Courtier (376 pp). Harvard University Press. * == Other websites == * * (A 1905 study by J. Dover Wilson) * Category:1550s births Category:1606 deaths Category:People from Kentucky Category:Alumni of the University of Cambridge
title: John Lyly
